page.title: 14Tourism and Recreation.
page.content: On Friday 12th July 1985 we went down to the beach and did a survey about Felixstowe. We did this because we wanted to ask tourists what they thought about our town. When we got there we split into four groups. One group went down on the beach, another group went outside Charlie Mannings and other amusments; another group went to the gardens and along the promenade. The last group went near the hotels. Most of the people we asked were elderly people, because the young people were at school and the middle aged ones were at work. Some people were sitting in sun chairs on the beach.Many were walking along and mothers were pushing babies. The weather on that afternoon was breezy but warm and sunny.We were glad the weather was so nice because it attracted the tourists.
